oai_dc:dc.dc:title: William Henry Hastie, nominated by the President for Federal Judge
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Embracing Citizenship
Civic Engagement
African American judges
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A portrait photograph of William Henry Hastie appears on the cover of Crisis Magazine.

William H. Hastie (1904-1976) who was born in Knoxville, graduated from Amherst College and Harvard Law School. Hastie was the first African American appointed to a federal judgeship. He served first in the U.S. Virgin Islands, where he later became as governor. In 1949, President Harry Truman selected him for the Third Circuit Court of Appeals in Philadelphia.
